Description: Scarab in glazed composition; back well-modelled, but markings rubbed off, only clypeus visible; well modelled legs, with feathering on front legs and well marked undercut triangular space between front and back legs; underside incised quite crudely with figure of a kneeling Hapy (or other fertility figure), featuring his characteristic prominent belly, crowned by papyrus thicket, and holding Hes vase; longitudinally pierced; glaze lost; paste cream in colour.
Curator's comments: Such a motif is common on scarab. See for example BM 1904,0409.312, BM 1904,0409.685. A second scarab from Naukratis displays a figure of a kneeling Hapy, but associated with a raised cobra, not a Hes vase: Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum E.SC.70.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.079) (phase 3)
